* Represents a Deadline task, which is a specific type of Task with a by date.
* Constructs a Deadline task with the given description, status, and deadline date.
* @param description the description of the Deadline task
* @param isDone whether the task is completed or not
* @param by the deadline date of the task
public Deadline(String description, boolean isDone, LocalDate by) {
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task.
* where statusIcon is "X" if the task is done, or a space " " if not done.
* The by date is formatted as "MMM d yyyy".
* @return the string representation of the Deadline task
* Returns a string suitable for saving to a file, representing the Deadline task.
* The format is "D | status | description | deadlineDate",
* where status is "1" if the task is done, or "0" if not done.
* The deadline date is represented in default LocalDate format.
* @return the string representation of the Deadline task for saving to a file
* The main entry point for the Elon application.
* Initializes and runs the application, handling user input and interactions.
* Constructs an Elon object with the specified Storage.
* @param storage the Storage object used for loading and saving tasks
* Starts the application by greeting the user, loading the task list,
* and processing user input commands through the Parser.
* @throws ElonException if an error occurs during command processing
Parser parser = new Parser(this.ui, list, scanner, inputArr, this.storage);
* The main method to run the Elon application.
* Initializes the Storage and Elon objects and starts the application.
* Represents an exception encompassing all elon chatbot related errors
* Constructs an ElonException receiving a specified error message.
* Represents an Event task, which is a specific type of Task with a start and end date.
* Constructs an Event task with the given description, status, start date, and end date.
* @param description the description of the Event task
* @param isDone whether the task is completed or not
* @param start the start date of the Event
* @param end the end date of the Event
public Event(String description, boolean isDone, LocalDate start, LocalDate end) {
* Returns a string representation of the Event task.
* The format is "[E][statusIcon] description (from: startDate to: endDate)",
* where statusIcon is "X" if the task is done or a space if not done.
* Description is the description of the task and dates are formatted as "MMM d yyyy".
* @return the string representation of the Event task
* Returns a string suitable for saving to a file, representing the Event task.
* The format is "E | status | description | startDate | endDate",
* where status is "1" if the task is done, or "0" if not done.
* Dates are represented in default LocalDate format.
* @return the string representation of the Event task for saving to a file
* Parses user input commands and interacts with the UI, TaskList, and Storage.
* Constructs a Parser object with the specified UI, TaskList, Scanner, input array, and Storage.
* @param ui         the UI object for interacting with the user
* @param scanner    the Scanner object for reading user input
* @param inputArr   the array of user input split into commands
* @param storage    the Storage object for saving and loading tasks
public Parser(Ui ui, TaskList list, Scanner scanner, String[] inputArr, Storage storage) {

* @param scanner the Scanner object used to read the input
* @return an array of strings representing the user input
* Handles the loading and saving of tasks to and from a file.
* Constructs a Storage object with the specified file path.
* If the file does not exist at the given path, it attempts to create a new file.
* @param path the path to the file where tasks are stored
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs when creating the file
* Parses a line from the file into a Task object then returns it.
* The line format should be "type | status | description | [additional details]".
* @param line the line from the file to be parsed
* @return the Task object represented by the line
* @throws ElonException if the line format is invalid or cannot be parsed
private Task parseTask(String line) throws ElonException {
return new Event(description, isDone, start, end);

* Each task is written to the file in a format suitable for later loading.
* @param list the TaskList containing the tasks to be saved
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs while writing to the file
public void saveFile(TaskList list) throws IOException {
* Represents a task with a description and a status indicating whether it is done.
* Constructs a Task object with the given description and status.
* @param isDone whether the task is completed or not
* Returns a status icon with "X" representing the task as done and a space " " as not.
* @return the status icon of the task
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns whether the task is done.
* @return true if the task is done, otherwise false
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* The format is "[statusIcon] description", where statusIcon is "X" if the task is done,
* or a space " " if not done, and description is the description of the task.
* @return the string representation of the task
* Marks the task as done by setting isDone to true.
* Marks the task as not done by setting isDone to false;
* Returns the string representation of the task suitable for saving to a file.

* Constructs a TaskList with the given list of tasks.

* Checks if the TaskList is empty.
* @return true if the list is empty, otherwise false
* Returns the task at the specified index from the list.
* @param index the index of the task to retrieve
* @return the task at the specified index
* Checks if the task at the specified index is done.
* @param index the index of the task to check
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise
* Marks the task at the specified index as not done.
* @param index the index of the task to mark as not done
* Marks the task at the specified index as done.

* Adds a new task to the list.

* Removes the task at the specified index from the list.
* @param index the index of the task to remove
* Returns the number of tasks in the TaskList.

* @param keyword the keyword to find in the tasks' descriptions
* @return an ArrayList of matching Task objects
* Represents a ToDo task, which is a specific type of Task.
* Constructs a ToDo task with the given description and status.
* @param description the description of the ToDo task
* @param isDone whether the task is completed or not
* Returns a string representation of the ToDo task.
* The format is "[T][statusIcon] description", where statusIcon is "X" if the task is done,
* or a space " " if not done, and description is the description of the task
* @return the string representation of the ToDo task
* Returns a string suitable for saving to a file, representing the ToDo task.
* The format is "T | status | description", where status is "1" if the task is done, or "0" if not done,
* and description is the description of the task.
* @return the string representation of the ToDo task for saving to a file
* Provides user interface functions for interacting with the task list and its tasks.
* Draws a horizontal line in the console for separation.
* Prints a greeting message to the console.
System.out.println("\t What can I do for you?");
* Prints a goodbye message to the console.
System.out.println("\t Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints the number of tasks currently in the task list.
* @param size the number of tasks in the list
System.out.println(String.format("\t Now you have %d tasks in the list.", size));
* Prints the tasks in the list to the console.
* If the list is empty, prints a message indicating that there are no tasks.
* Otherwise, prints each task with its index, incremented by 1 from the index in the list.
* @param list the TaskList containing tasks to be displayed
System.out.println("\t There are no tasks in your list.");
System.out.println("\t Here are the tasks in your list:");

public void markTask(int index, TaskList list) {

System.out.println("\t Nice! I've marked this task as done:");

public void unmarkTask(int index, TaskList list) {

* Prints a message indicating that a task has been added to the list.
